timeline.title: Initial Research & Planning
timeline.description: Researching smart mirror projects, setting goals, and planning the feature set.

timeline.title: Setting Up Raspberry Pi
timeline.description: Installing Raspberry Pi OS, configuring MagicMirror², and testing the basic setup.

timeline.title: Feature Integration and portfolio updating
timeline.description: In this week I will update my portfolio to include multiple pages.

timeline.title: Project timeline creation and weekly updates section to summarize actual additions
timeline.description: Update portfolio to include a project page with project timeline, weekly real-time updates, and in the future implement a framework to present my MVP.

timeline.title: Portfolio Cleanup & Early Prototype Submission
timeline.description: I will completely overhaul the portfolio to be in React/JSX/CSX with easy-to-edit JSON files rather than keeping the single HTML files with bad styling.

weeklyUpdates.title: Completed Initial Research
weeklyUpdates.description: Gathered information on different smart mirror frameworks and planned project requirements.

weeklyUpdates.title: Set Up Raspberry Pi
weeklyUpdates.description: Successfully installed Raspberry Pi OS and configured the MagicMirror² framework.

weeklyUpdates.title: Constructed portfolio
weeklyUpdates.description: Made the framework and started my HTML website portfolio through GitHub.

weeklyUpdates.title: Cleaned up portfolio
weeklyUpdates.description: Made a separate research page on the portfolio to keep the research portion of the project separate.

weeklyUpdates.title: Portfolio remodel and additional module implementation
weeklyUpdates.description: Reconstructed portfolio in React architecture, making it easier to add additional pages and create a proper page system with different CSS files. Implemented more Magic Mirror modules like a date and time display with a handmade school-schedule progress bar.

weeklyUpdates.title: Portfolio additions and further project cleanup
weeklyUpdates.description: Added a project weekly-updates timeline section to the Projects page in my website, and implemented image-importing CSS with a decorative border.

weeklyUpdates.title: Spotify support for the mirror
weeklyUpdates.description: Integrated Spotify authentication; the mirror can now pair to a Bluetooth speaker and display current track info.

weeklyUpdates.title: Updated portfolio with cleaner CSS
weeklyUpdates.description: Refreshed the color palette, typography, and shadow depth; moved hard-coded content into JSON for easier updates.

weeklyUpdates.title: Submitted MVP write-up
weeklyUpdates.description: Documented our minimum-viable mirror in a formal report and pushed it to the project site.

weeklyUpdates.title: Measured & Modeled the Enclosure
weeklyUpdates.description: Used digital calipers to record exact dimensions of the monitor, Pi, and power hardware; created a tight-tolerance CAD model of the frame and back housing in Fusion 360.

weeklyUpdates.title: Test-Print Tolerance Coupons
weeklyUpdates.description: Printed small fit-check coupons to verify the caliper-derived clearances (press-fits, snap lugs, cable channels) and tweaked the CAD until each part slid smoothly with no wobble.

weeklyUpdates.title: Sectioned & Printed Full-Size Parts
weeklyUpdates.description: Split the oversized frame into four dovetailed quadrants to fit the 220 × 220 mm bed; printed all pieces in PETG, pausing mid-print for accent-color layers.

weeklyUpdates.title: Assembled & Weight-Reduced the Frame
weeklyUpdates.description: Epoxy-glued and clamped the quadrants, then reinforced seams with printed splines; added honeycomb cut-outs in non-structural zones to save about 30 % filament and 120 g of weight.

weeklyUpdates.title: Final Finishing & Cable-Routing Holes
weeklyUpdates.description: Wet-sanded seams, filled gaps with PLA putty, sprayed two coats of satin black, and drilled oval pass-throughs for USB-C/HDMI; installed heat-set inserts for removable rear panels.

MVP.title: Total project completion at this point
MVP.description: The MVP is a monitor connected over HDMI to a Raspberry Pi, displaying time, weather, and a VHHS period-schedule progress bar. Spotify information works, and a Pi Camera streams video for future facial recognition.

finalPresentation.title: Final Product Demo
finalPresentation.description: A walkthrough of the finished smart mirror, including the 3-D-printed housing, cable management, ambient LED lighting, Spotify playback, and a facial-recognition preview.
